intro: Ruellia saeri, commonly known as the saeri ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Ruellia saeri is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
